key_points: Chris Cuomo advised his brother, New York Gov. Andrew Cuomo, to resign amidst a sexual harassment scandal.
Chris addressed the issue upon returning to his CNN show "Cuomo Primetime" after a vacation.
He stated he never covered the scandal on CNN due to a conflict of interest but did offer his brother personal advice.
Chris Cuomo's advice to Andrew included owning his actions, being contrite, and realizing perceptions of his actions matter more than intent.
There's an ongoing federal investigation into Andrew Cuomo's handling of COVID-19 in nursing homes and another by the Attorney General into misuse of state resources for his book.
Chris Cuomo stated he never misled anyone on his show nor attempted to control CNN's coverage of his family.
In May, Chris acknowledged discussing advisory strategies with his brother and his staff, a move he later apologized for after CNN expressed it was inappropriate.
Gov. Andrew Cuomo announced his resignation, to be effective in 14 days from his announcement, after a damning report by the Attorney General.
The report found Andrew Cuomo sexually harassed 11 women, violating state and federal laws.
Chris Cuomo emphasized his commitment to doing the right thing and maintaining professional integrity despite the unique situation.
